item.title: Install Karpenter on an EKS cluster with CDK
item.description: Karpenter is an OSS that scales nodes of a Kubernetes cluster developed by AWS. Compared to Cluster Autoscaler, it can perform fast and flexible provisioning not through Auto Scaling Group. It supports only EKS so far, but it seems to have possibility to support other cloud providers. In this article, I install Karpenter on an EKS cluster with CDK, and confirm nodes to be auto-scaled when the number of replicas is changed.

item.title: Register an EKS cluster launched with CDK to EMR on EKS and run Spark jobs
